info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 1:48PM CDT until May 18 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Jefferson and Shelby.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hoover, Bessemer, Pelham, Helena, Indian Springs Village, Hoover Metropolitan Stadium, Riverchase, Patton Creek, Ross Bridge, Riverchase Galleria, Oak Mountain Amphitheater, Oak Mountain State Park, Lake Cyrus, Bessemer Airport and Bent Brook Golf Club.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
